numbered_ace_sentences: 2. A legacy applicant has a significantly higher chance of admission to the school.
3. It seems that schools care about passing on the legacy of attending their school.
5. Being in the 70th percentile to the 90th percentile decreases the chance of acceptance.
6. Parents of a student in the 70th percentile to the 90th percentile have more money to afford the school.
7. I wonder why the school decreases the number of students in this income bracket.
9. I am not a legacy applicant to the colleges that I would like to attend.
10. I try to get admitted in a non-traditional way.
11. I try to get admitted by being recruited for gymnastics.
12. If I am recruited for gymnastics then I can circumvent many issues.
13. Not being a legacy applicant is an issue.
14. The headline is: Elite College Admissions Unveiled.
